content: @Jason Walonoski What's the right way to report issues with crucible tests? The test XFER4: Transaction Processing Order of Operations seems to be deleting a resource in a transaction and then expecting a GET in the same transaction to return that resource.

@James Agnew, you could send a message to the fhir-testing-list@lists.mitre.org mailing list (that is the "Contact Us" link on the Crucible page) or submit a github issue at https://github.com/fhir-crucible/plan_executor/issues
@James Agnew I'll add a task for us to reexamine XFER4. Thanks for the heads up.
@Jason Walonoski In https://projectcrucible.org/ there are tests like "Argonaut Sprint3". Where are these define? (I don't see Sprint3 in any of the repos at https://github.com/fhir-crucible/
@Josh Mandel You can find them in the fhir-crucible/plan_executor project under lib/tests/suites - https://github.com/fhir-crucible/plan_executor/tree/master/lib/tests/suites

As announced at the FHIR Connectathon, the Crucible open source project is looking for new project contributors and maintainers! We're happy to accept new issues, pull requests, edits to the wiki, and discussion. Please join us in automating the continuous testing of FHIR!

Please see our wiki (https://github.com/fhir-crucible/crucible/wiki) to start contributing or join the new Crucible stream here in Zulip (https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/crucible).

Thanks.
